svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
May 4, 2024" date: "2024-05-04"
* Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Recap from Alex Stokes .Â Notes
from Christine Kim : Confirmation rule research : algorithm determines if block always
in canonical chain Pectra-devnet-0 : plan to launch in ~10 days, client teams making
good progress, attestation refactoring for EIP7549 taking extra time EIP7684 return
deposits for distinct credentials : proposal to mitigate deposit front-running for
staking pools PeerDAS : client teams making progress, synchrony assumption on sampling
Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Recap from Alex Stokes .Â Notes
* Confirmation rule research : algorithm determines if block always in canonical chain
Confirmation rule research : algorithm determines if block always in canonical chain
* Pectra-devnet-0 : plan to launch in ~10 days, client teams making good progress,
attestation refactoring for EIP7549 taking extra time
Pectra-devnet-0 : plan to launch in ~10 days, client teams making good progress,
* EIP7684 return deposits for distinct credentials : proposal to mitigate deposit
EIP7684 return deposits for distinct credentials : proposal to mitigate deposit
* PeerDAS : client teams making progress, synchrony assumption on sampling discussion
PeerDAS : client teams making progress, synchrony assumption on sampling discussion
* consensus-specs/releases v1.5.0-alpha.1 : CL spec target of pectra-devnet-0, bug
fixes for test cases & new fork tests
consensus-specs/releases v1.5.0-alpha.1 : CL spec target of pectra-devnet-0, bug fixes
for test cases & new fork tests
* Future of EOA/AA breakout call #2 scheduled for May 7 Yoav Weiss: Account
Abstraction roadmap , towards native AA starting with L2
Future of EOA/AA breakout call #2 scheduled for May 7
* Yoav Weiss: Account Abstraction roadmap , towards native AA starting with L2
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.68% still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.68% still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~63% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 38% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
* Slashing Proofoor : prove a validator hasnâ€™t been slashed using EIP4788 beacon block
Slashing Proofoor : prove a validator hasnâ€™t been slashed using EIP4788 beacon block
* Terence: builder reveal timing game post ePBS
Terence: builder reveal timing game post ePBS
* Consensus layer: Nimbus v24.4.0 : stability & performance improvements
* Execution layer: Erigon Otterscan v2.5.0 alpha : improved Optimism support
* Erigon Otterscan v2.5.0 alpha : improved Optimism support
* Otterscan v2.5.0 alpha : improved Optimism support
* Teku adds client info to graffiti : appends client types & versions to improve
* Lattice Redstone live, uses Plasma mode offchain data availability
* EIPs: EIP7701 : Native account abstraction with EOF
* EIP7701 : Native account abstraction with EOF
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7700 : Cross-chain storage router protocol
* EIP5792 site (wallet call API): API reference, capabilities & ecosystem support
EIP5792 site (wallet call API): API reference, capabilities & ecosystem support
* Wagmi v2.8.0 : adds experimental EIP5792 actions & hooks
Wagmi v2.8.0 : adds experimental EIP5792 actions & hooks
* Reth Execution Extensions (ExEx): post-execution hooks for building offchain
Reth Execution Extensions (ExEx): post-execution hooks for building offchain
* Pike ~$2M in two exploits , first via weak security handling of cross-chain transfer
protocol transfers (identified by auditor) and second via faulty upgrade to pause the
Pike ~$2M in two exploits , first via weak security handling of cross-chain transfer
* DeFi risk modeling : security implications of economic research
DeFi risk modeling : security implications of economic research
* ChainSafe: Head of Protocol Engineering and Developer Relations - Sygma
ChainSafe: Head of Protocol Engineering and Developer Relations - Sygma
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 3.4 to 91.4 gwei, with 8.4 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 23.2 gwei 11k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 3.4 to 91.4 gwei, with 8.4 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 23.2 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 23.2 gwei
* Fantasy.top (CryptoTwitter fantasy sports game) live on Blast. If you need a signup
Fantasy.top (CryptoTwitter fantasy sports game) live on Blast.
* If you need a signup code
* Eigen token , non-transferable & airdrop geoblocked after allowing deposits from
Eigen token , non-transferable & airdrop geoblocked after allowing deposits from those
* Aave proposed roadmap : v4, cross-chain liquidity layer, real world asset products
built around GHO stablecoin and Aave network
Aave proposed roadmap : v4, cross-chain liquidity layer, real world asset products
* DefiLama airdrops : check any address, no signing or signup required
DefiLama airdrops : check any address, no signing or signup required
* Gitcoin Grants donation history for an address
Gitcoin Grants donation history for an address
* A look at yields in DeFi this week
A look at yields in DeFi this week
* Former Binance CEO CZ sentenced to four months prison
Former Binance CEO CZ sentenced to four months prison
* Vitalik: Binius , efficient proofs over binary fields
Vitalik: Binius , efficient proofs over binary fields
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
* May 10-11 â€“ ETH Bratislava conference & hackathon
May 10-11 â€“ ETH Bratislava conference & hackathon
* May 31-Jun 5 â€“ ETH Belgrade hackathon & conference
May 31-Jun 5 â€“ ETH Belgrade hackathon & conference
* Jun 14 â€“ EF EIP4844 data challenge deadline
Jun 14 â€“ EF EIP4844 data challenge deadline
* Aug 23-Sep 13 â€“ ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
Aug 23-Sep 13 â€“ ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
* Oct 18-20 â€“ ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
Oct 18-20 â€“ ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
